name: Giant Onion
climate: Giant Onions thrive in temperate climates with a well-defined winter cold period.
These plants prefer climates that do not experience extreme heat or dry conditions.
The ideal climate for giant onions includes mild winters and cool, moist conditions.
Giant onions require a seasonal change to stimulate growth, favoring cooler climates.
sunlight: Giant Onions require full sun to partial shade to grow optimally.
These plants need a minimum of six hours of direct sunlight for best results.
While they tolerate some shade, full sunlight ensures proper bulb development.
Giant Onions do not grow well in deep shade and need exposure to sunlight.
watering: Consistent moisture is crucial, but the soil should never become waterlogged.
During germination and early growth, maintain even watering for healthy roots.
Reduce watering frequency as the plant matures to prevent rot in the bulbs.
Well-draining soil helps prevent water stagnation, which can harm giant onions.
soil: Giant Onions prefer fertile, well-drained soil rich in organic matter.
The ideal soil should be loose and aerated, allowing roots to expand easily.
Soil pH should be neutral to slightly acidic, ranging from 6.0 to 7.0 for best growth.
Incorporating compost or well-rotted manure can enrich the soil, boosting plant health.
extra_care_tip: Provide a thick mulch layer to conserve moisture and suppress weeds around the plants.
